Subject: Digital Technologies
ContentDescription: Investigate the main internal components of common digital systems and their function
Elaboration: Investigating the main components in a videoconferencing system and their functions, for example a telehealth system used to access imaging services by communities in areas classified as rural or remote such as those of some Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander Peoples

Subject: Digital Technologies
ContentDescription: Investigate the main internal components of common digital systems and their function
Elaboration: Explaining how digital systems are made up of parts that perform specific functions, for example the central processing unit (CPU), memory and input/output components working together to perform calculations and manipulate data

Subject: Digital Technologies
ContentDescription: Investigate the main internal components of common digital systems and their function
Elaboration: Exploring the difference between the internal components of a range of digital systems, for example desktop computers, laptop computers and tablet devices

Subject: Digital Technologies
ContentDescription: Examine how digital systems form networks to transmit data
Elaboration: Investigating the use of satellite phones where mobile phone networks are not available, inaccessible or unreliable; for example, rural and remote Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander communities have limited access to mainstream communication networks

Subject: Digital Technologies
ContentDescription: Examine how digital systems form networks to transmit data
Elaboration: Explaining how separate systems can be connected in different ways to exchange data, for example how a laptop can be connected to a network via a cable or wireless via radio waves

Subject: Digital Technologies
ContentDescription: Examine how digital systems form networks to transmit data
Elaboration: Describing the way data is structured and transmitted through a network, for example broken up into packets (small pieces) and passed from the source, through multiple devices, to the destination

Subject: Digital Technologies
ContentDescription: Access multiple personal accounts using unique passphrases and explain the risks of password re-use
Elaboration: Using multiple accounts, each with different passphrases, to access each website or app used for school and home, for example having a different username and password combination for school, gaming and music accounts

Subject: Digital Technologies
ContentDescription: Access multiple personal accounts using unique passphrases and explain the risks of password re-use
Elaboration: Explaining why re-using a password is risky, for example how a compromised password from one social media account might be able to be used to access their bank or school account if the password is the same, which means that other details are also compromised

Subject: Digital Technologies
ContentDescription: Explain how digital systems represent all data using numbers and explore how data can be represented using binary
Elaboration: Making collaboratively a long thread with beads representing binary for the letters that spell the Country name in the language of the local Aboriginal People and in English, and that could be displayed as a ‘binary banner’ as an Acknowledgement of Country that they are on the Traditional Lands of the <insert name> People

Subject: Digital Technologies
ContentDescription: Explain how digital systems represent all data using numbers and explore how data can be represented using binary
Elaboration: Representing data using whole numbers and recognising this is how digital systems represent data, for example converting letters in a message to numbers using their positions in the alphabet

Subject: Digital Technologies
ContentDescription: Explain how digital systems represent all data using numbers and explore how data can be represented using binary
Elaboration: Recognising how digital systems represent data, for example converting letters in a message to Unicode or ASCII

Subject: Digital Technologies
ContentDescription: Explain how digital systems represent all data using numbers and explore how data can be represented using binary
Elaboration: Demonstrating that an on/off state in a circuit can represent the digits 1 and 0 and that this is how digital systems represent data

Subject: Digital Technologies
ContentDescription: Explain how digital systems represent all data using numbers and explore how data can be represented using binary
Elaboration: Recognising how the answer to a yes/no question can be represented using on/off states, for example switching a light in an electric circuit on or off

Subject: Digital Technologies
ContentDescription: Acquire and manipulate different types of data from a range of sources using software tools, including spreadsheets
Elaboration: Acquiring data from a range of online sources by narrowing the focus, for example filtering data using provided options or performing queries using advanced search functions

Subject: Digital Technologies
ContentDescription: Acquire and manipulate different types of data from a range of sources using software tools, including spreadsheets
Elaboration: Recognising the difference between numerical, text and date formats in spreadsheets

Subject: Digital Technologies
ContentDescription: Acquire and manipulate different types of data from a range of sources using software tools, including spreadsheets
Elaboration: Using spreadsheets to sort data when solving problems, for example sorting numerical data into ascending or descending order

Subject: Digital Technologies
ContentDescription: Acquire and manipulate different types of data from a range of sources using software tools, including spreadsheets
Elaboration: Using spreadsheets to automate calculations to help with interpreting data, for example using functions to make arithmetic calculations using multiple cells and summing cell ranges

Subject: Digital Technologies
ContentDescription: Acquire and manipulate different types of data from a range of sources using software tools, including spreadsheets
Elaboration: Understanding how artificial intelligence (AI) uses machine learning to train algorithms to recognise patterns in data to improve decision-making, for example selecting results to include in a data set

Subject: Digital Technologies
ContentDescription: Analyse and visualise data using a range of software, including spreadsheets to create information and solve problems
Elaboration: Exploring online resources to identify and examine the characteristics of data visualisations, for example analysing the Bureau of Meteorology’s weather planning data visualisations

Subject: Digital Technologies
ContentDescription: Analyse and visualise data using a range of software, including spreadsheets to create information and solve problems
Elaboration: Using spreadsheets to format data, for example using conditional formatting

Subject: Digital Technologies
ContentDescription: Analyse and visualise data using a range of software, including spreadsheets to create information and solve problems
Elaboration: Using data visualisation software to present information visually, for example creating a range of charts on a topic in a spreadsheet

Subject: Digital Technologies
ContentDescription: Analyse and visualise data using a range of software, including spreadsheets to create information and solve problems
Elaboration: Using AI tools in spreadsheets to assist in the creation of information, for example using AI tools to generate formulas and charts

Subject: Digital Technologies
ContentDescription: Select and use appropriate digital tools effectively to create, locate and communicate content, applying common conventions for a diverse audience
Elaboration: Locating content through search engines and in electronic documents by revising queries and using required search terms, for example reviewing search results and modifying search terms to make the query more accurate

Subject: Digital Technologies
ContentDescription: Select and use appropriate digital tools effectively to create, locate and communicate content, applying common conventions for a diverse audience
Elaboration: Creating appropriate content that reflects planning as well as new external factors, for example uploading or sharing a draft of a report on a local government issue to the teacher for feedback as part of an iterative process

Subject: Digital Technologies
ContentDescription: Select and use appropriate digital tools effectively to create, locate and communicate content, applying common conventions for a diverse audience
Elaboration: Creating content for a school celebration, for example designing a collaborative spreadsheet that can be used by a small group to plan and cost their graduation party, together with a folder of tagged resources that support the planning

Subject: Digital Technologies
ContentDescription: Select and use appropriate digital tools effectively to create, locate and communicate content, applying common conventions for a diverse audience
Elaboration: Naming, organising and storing files in a way that allows for easy retrieval of shared content, for example labelling the main folders by topic, such as ‘school garden project’, and then creating subfolders for each section of the project, such as ‘plans’, ‘designs’ and ‘implementation’

Subject: Digital Technologies
ContentDescription: Select and use appropriate digital tools effectively to create, locate and communicate content, applying common conventions for a diverse audience
Elaboration: Understanding the tone and appropriateness for the intended audience of text generated using AI tools, for example deciding that predictive text is too formal for a conversation with a friend and rewriting it in a less formal way

Subject: Digital Technologies
ContentDescription: Select and use appropriate digital tools effectively to share content online, plan tasks and collaborate on projects, demonstrating agreed behaviours, supported by trusted adults
Elaboration: Demonstrating agreed behaviours; following cultural protocols, including relevant permissions and attributions; acknowledging diversity, capability and strength; and addressing risks and responsibilities such as privacy, security and accuracy of data, for example when sharing images of Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander Peoples’ cultural artefacts

Subject: Digital Technologies
ContentDescription: Select and use appropriate digital tools effectively to share content online, plan tasks and collaborate on projects, demonstrating agreed behaviours, supported by trusted adults
Elaboration: Creating achievable steps and timelines and identifying digital tools needed to produce a solution to a given problem, for example planning what they need to do to create a report on the effectiveness of the school’s recycling initiatives

Subject: Digital Technologies
ContentDescription: Select and use appropriate digital tools effectively to share content online, plan tasks and collaborate on projects, demonstrating agreed behaviours, supported by trusted adults
Elaboration: Following a previously created plan to report back to the class on a given problem, using digital tools, for example small groups reporting on the best location for a new skate park in the local government area

Subject: Digital Technologies
ContentDescription: Select and use appropriate digital tools effectively to share content online, plan tasks and collaborate on projects, demonstrating agreed behaviours, supported by trusted adults
Elaboration: Defining and acting collectively using online community standards and valuing the work of others, for example moderating language and behaviour in an online class forum, not deleting the work of collaborators, and respecting others’ intellectual property

Subject: Digital Technologies
ContentDescription: Select and use appropriate digital tools effectively to share content online, plan tasks and collaborate on projects, demonstrating agreed behaviours, supported by trusted adults
Elaboration: Using a range of communication tools to share ideas and information with other students, for example presenting content for a school celebration such as a graduation celebration

Subject: Digital Technologies
ContentDescription: Explain the creation and permanence of their personal digital footprint and consider privacy when collecting personal data
Elaboration: Describing scenarios where data, images or both that have been posted online can lead to information reappearing at a later date, for example how a comment made on a social media post or video associates a person with both their comment and the content

Subject: Digital Technologies
ContentDescription: Explain the creation and permanence of their personal digital footprint and consider privacy when collecting personal data
Elaboration: Explaining why collecting the smallest amount of data needed for a purpose is important to protect someone’s privacy, for example how choosing not to collect information about someone’s birthdate when it is not necessary ensures that private data cannot be stolen in a cyber attack

Subject: Digital Technologies
ContentDescription: Explain the creation and permanence of their personal digital footprint and consider privacy when collecting personal data
Elaboration: Understanding the implications of how AI models are trained through the collection of data, for example the sharing of personal data increases the likelihood that private information will be collected and revealed through AI models both now and in the future

Subject: Digital Technologies
ContentDescription: Define problems with teacher-provided or co-developed functional requirements
Elaboration: Developing a problem statement and co-developing functional requirements as a class activity for developing a solution for tracking the impact of feral animals on native flora and fauna that could be used by Aboriginal and/or Torres Strait Islander rangers

Subject: Digital Technologies
ContentDescription: Define problems with teacher-provided or co-developed functional requirements
Elaboration: Describing in simple terms the nature of a problem and what a solution needs to achieve, for example what need the problem is addressing, who the solution is needed for, what data is needed and what features the solution would need to include

Subject: Digital Technologies
ContentDescription: Define problems with teacher-provided or co-developed functional requirements
Elaboration: Using teacher-provided functional requirements to identify the features needed for a new digital solution, for example identifying what is required for a new game to be developed for children of primary school age

Subject: Digital Technologies
ContentDescription: Define problems with teacher-provided or co-developed functional requirements
Elaboration: Using a provided stimulus to identify a need, and writing functional requirements in groups, for example developing requirements for a class app to share ideas and work collaboratively

Subject: Digital Technologies
ContentDescription: Design and represent algorithms involving multiple alternatives (branching) and iteration
Elaboration: Designing an algorithm, including branching and iteration, that responds to data, for example how Aboriginal and/or Torres Strait Islander rangers use structured procedures to respond to live tracking data that indicates feral buffalo are approaching an environmentally or culturally sensitive site

Subject: Digital Technologies
ContentDescription: Design and represent algorithms involving multiple alternatives (branching) and iteration
Elaboration: Designing an algorithm or understanding and modifying an existing algorithm to fix an error or change functionality, for example finding and fixing an error in branching involving a boundary condition

Subject: Digital Technologies
ContentDescription: Design and represent algorithms involving multiple alternatives (branching) and iteration
Elaboration: Constructing more than one sequence of steps that solve the same problem and explaining why one is better than the other, for example specifying an exact route through a maze versus using the right-hand rule, which works for all mazes

Subject: Digital Technologies
ContentDescription: Design and represent algorithms involving multiple alternatives (branching) and iteration
Elaboration: Modelling a decision that has more than 2 options to select the next step, for example selecting transport: ‘IF distance is less than 2 km THEN walk, ELSE IF distance is less than 5 km THEN ride a bike, ELSE catch the bus’

Subject: Digital Technologies
ContentDescription: Design and represent algorithms involving multiple alternatives (branching) and iteration
Elaboration: Planning algorithms that repeat until a condition is met, for example continuing to mix UNTIL ingredients are combined or subtracting a number UNTIL the result reaches zero

Subject: Digital Technologies
ContentDescription: Design and modify a user interface for a digital system, and generate, communicate and evaluate the designs
Elaboration: Designing a user interface on paper or using digital tools, for example drawing the designed layout of the landing page of an app to order lunches from the school canteen or using customisable font size and colour contrast to help users with impaired vision

Subject: Digital Technologies
ContentDescription: Design and modify a user interface for a digital system, and generate, communicate and evaluate the designs
Elaboration: Modelling how user interfaces allow people of different cultures and with different language backgrounds to access information, for example using consistent symbols to represent common actions such as copying, pasting and saving

Subject: Digital Technologies
ContentDescription: Design and modify a user interface for a digital system, and generate, communicate and evaluate the designs
Elaboration: Ideating a range of possible design ideas, discussing them and judging them against the teacher-provided or co-developed functional requirements, for example using the functional requirements to put design ideas in order of preference in a group discussion

Subject: Digital Technologies
ContentDescription: Design and modify a user interface for a digital system, and generate, communicate and evaluate the designs
Elaboration: Suggesting modifications to a preferred design idea if it does not satisfy all the functional requirements, for example modifying a game or game controller so that it can be used by a wider range of players

Subject: Digital Technologies
ContentDescription: Implement algorithms as visual programs involving control structures, variables and input
Elaboration: Programming digital systems to perform automated tasks, such as closing gates, for example simulating the work of Aboriginal and/or Torres Strait Islander rangers attempting to lure and capture feral animals

Subject: Digital Technologies
ContentDescription: Implement algorithms as visual programs involving control structures, variables and input
Elaboration: Writing and editing programs to solve problems using branching, iteration and variables in a visual programming environment, for example writing a program to draw a shape and rotate it a given number of times

Subject: Digital Technologies
ContentDescription: Implement algorithms as visual programs involving control structures, variables and input
Elaboration: Writing programs that repeat multiple steps based on the user’s input, for example repeatedly drawing a shape a given number of times, shifting the position between each iteration

Subject: Digital Technologies
ContentDescription: Implement algorithms as visual programs involving control structures, variables and input
Elaboration: Writing programs that take input from the user or environment and storing that input in a variable for later use, for example asking the user how many shapes to draw in a circle and using that to calculate the number of iterations and the angle to rotate each time

Subject: Digital Technologies
ContentDescription: Implement algorithms as visual programs involving control structures, variables and input
Elaboration: Writing programs that make decisions involving multiple alternatives, for example an interactive quiz that checks if an answer is correct, gives feedback and updates the score, or gives a final grade based on the score

Subject: Digital Technologies
ContentDescription: Implement algorithms as visual programs involving control structures, variables and input
Elaboration: Using an AI tool with a natural language interface to convert speech to text when implementing an algorithm in a visual programming environment

Subject: Digital Technologies
ContentDescription: Evaluate existing and student-created solutions against the requirements and their broader community impact
Elaboration: Evaluating the effectiveness of their own solutions to address the identified problem from the requirements, for example checking if the information created for a local interactive history walk is relevant and meets the local council’s needs

Subject: Digital Technologies
ContentDescription: Evaluate existing and student-created solutions against the requirements and their broader community impact
Elaboration: Evaluating how an existing solution provides users with safety tools and features such as those described in the eSafety Commissioner’s Safety by Design vision for young people, for example having a clearly visible button to easily report and block inappropriate behaviour in an app or on a website

Subject: Digital Technologies
ContentDescription: Evaluate existing and student-created solutions against the requirements and their broader community impact
Elaboration: Reflecting on the many systems that are used in the wider community to address a range of needs, for example timetables to manage transport and other services, and storing licence information so that police can enforce traffic laws

Subject: Digital Technologies
ContentDescription: Evaluate existing and student-created solutions against the requirements and their broader community impact
Elaboration: Verifying the correctness of AI-generated content against information known to be factually correct, for example comparing the text generated from an AI tool with information published on an official website or other authoritative sources
